messages: ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:36): i have made a Fascinating Discovery about Solaris !
737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (14:36): ``it works!''?
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:36): 62.189.34.58 = Solaris 8 Squid Proxy (228 Days Uptime)
737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (14:39): the only fascinating thing is your electrical power grid ;)
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:39): i think that is good uptime for a Busy Proxy Cache
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:41): its located in Sheffield, UK
737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (14:41): if the traffic is an indicator for the max. uptime w/o restarting, then you definitely use the wrong software
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:42): Squid software
737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (14:42): stable enough, if configured right and has a good underlying OS, then 200+ days are no miracle
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:43): is Solaris a Breed of FreeBSD ?
737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (14:44): ouch
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:44): i heard it was a BSD-like clone ?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (14:44): sunOS4 aka solaris 1 was bsd based back in the stone age
737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (14:45): the general direction is SysV, as far as i can analyze it
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:45): but solaris 10 is made from the ground up ?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (14:45): solaris 2-10 are all systemV based
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:46): i think my ISP uses a mixture of Linux/FreeBSD/Solaris in there Datacentre(s)

737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (14:50): `sigh: a modern SunOS is SysV
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (14:58): what do you guys think of modern day Linux ?
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (14:58): a modern SunOS 5 is SVR4, with some BSD additions.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (14:59): but mostly SVR4
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (14:59): the VMM system from SunOS 4 was brought over to SunOS 5, of course.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (14:59): along with Virtual filesystems
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:00): `sigh: its a pile of inconsistent poo.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:00): an aggregation of hacks. nothing more.
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (15:01): even Fedora Core ?
737df21fd27d1fa9f52bbecd9aa06182 (15:02): what should make FC so "different"?
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:02): `sigh: any "distribution" that uses the Linux kernel and a GNU userland is a pile of inconsistent poo.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:02): so, yes, this includes FC.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:02): and 100% of Linux distributions.
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (15:02): so FreeBSD and Solaris are better you think ?
c6d0bcb8a571d00062a3e5ec60589937 (15:03): the function of the operating system should be considered, aswell as its environment
429eef84ed906c0cca216e610454ca1f (15:03): how may one register .edu domains?
429eef84ed906c0cca216e610454ca1f (15:03): is there any particular site? any formalities? etc
c6d0bcb8a571d00062a3e5ec60589937 (15:04): I've studied the linux kernel, and it's not as horrible as you're making it out
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (15:04): educause
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:04): anoid`: how many of the kernel options are undocumented?
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:04): *cough* the majority *cough*
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:04): so yes, it is horrible.
c6d0bcb8a571d00062a3e5ec60589937 (15:05): that's part of any massive os project
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (15:05): kilai: http://www.educause.edu/edudomain/
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:05): anoid`: that's a very naive perspective.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:05): you should check out the Solaris tunables guide.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:05): everything is documented.
c6d0bcb8a571d00062a3e5ec60589937 (15:05): naive, or perhaps understanding
c6d0bcb8a571d00062a3e5ec60589937 (15:05): anyway as far as a typical user goes
c6d0bcb8a571d00062a3e5ec60589937 (15:05): linux is terrific
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (15:06): AIX and HP-UX are both UNIX btw too
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (15:06): every solaris kernel 'option' is documented
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (15:06): they may not be publically documented, but that's because they arent public options
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:07): `sigh: if its UNIX95, UNIX98, and UNIX2003 certified, its a UNIX.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:08): various versions of Solaris, AIX, and HP-UX have all been certified by one of those certifications at some point.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:08): (Solaris 7 is UNIX98, Solaris 10 is UNIX2003)
ab5d47751a2cf8d5059bb9672d15c1e6 (15:09): and IRIX and Compaq tru64 ?
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (15:09): yes, and there's a record of the certifications on the OpenGroup's website.
